alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 9:49AM PST until February 28 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow continued above 3500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches. * WHERE...Cascade mountains of Whatcom and Skagit Counties, including the Mount Baker Ski Area. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Scattered snow showers will turn to steady snow tonight as another weather system moves into the area. Several inches of snow are expected overnight before precipitation turns to rain Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes North Cascades and Passes
